items.title: Rockferry
items.description: Debut album from the young Welsh soul siren.

items.title: Elephunk
items.description: LA hip hop crew's third album, full throttle funk.

items.title: Goodbye Yellow Brick Road
items.description: Original double album now single CD release, reckoned by some to be Sir Elton's finest, from rockers like Satuday Night's Alright for Fighting to the classis ballad Candle in the Wind.

items.title: Below the Salt
items.description: Maddy Prior leads on this carefully chosen selection of traditional folk songs.

items.title: Abraxas
items.description: Commercial breakthrough album for Santana showcasing their post-Woodstock talent at its best.

items.title: Twelve Dreams of Dr Sardonicus
items.description: Spitit\'s final and finest experimental album.

items.title: Achtung Baby
items.description: More techno-rock than stadium pop, this album marked a change of direction for U2.

items.title: Fisherman's Blues
items.description: Going back to their Celtic roots for these folk rockers, backed by fiddles and acoustic guitars.

items.title: The Delivery Man
items.description: Backed again by the Imposters, this is a concept album featuring a selection of fine guest appearances from the likes of Lucimda Williams.

items.title: Dead Man's Suit
items.description: Tuneful soft rock debut with some standout lyrics.

items.title: The Owl of Minerva
items.description: Ground breaking collection from Brighton based team, previously only available on Vinyl.

items.title: Surfer Rosa
items.description: Typically abrasive selection of guitar and vocal combinationsClassic.

items.title: Neon Bible
items.description: Second release from the Canadian folk rockers, easily passing the predecessor in scope and depth.

items.title: Separation Sunday
items.description: Play it loud - original take on classic rock. Recommended.

items.title: Blue
items.description: Introspective and highly personal, Joni Mitchell bares  her soul on this all time classic.

items.title: Solid Air
items.description: Landmark album crossing from the folky to free form, jazz improvisation. Conatining the all time great May You Never.

items.title: Couldn't Stand The Weather
items.description: The second album from the late and almented Vaughan, consolidating his position as a leading light of modern blues.

items.title: Enjoy The Melodic Sunshine
items.description: Hard to believe this Glasgow group can produce the sunniest West Coast rock and best harmonies since The Byrds

items.title: Live At Folsom Prison
items.description: Quintessential Cash, recorded live  at Folsom Prison. With his wife June Carter Cash.

items.title: Live at the Apollo
items.description: One of the greatest live albums of all time, from a performer at the peak of his career.

items.title: Hold Your Colour
items.description: Classic debut album

items.title: The Fat Of The Land
items.description: Third studio album, featuring the singles Firestarterand Breathe
